main.name: Eric Chou
main.bio: Hi, I'm Eric. I am currently a senior computer science major at the University of California, Irvine. I am interested in becoming a software engineer in the future focused on the fields of AI, machine learning, and information retrieval. Some projects I am working on are a Supreme Bot and a keyphrase identification model used to classify large datasets of text.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.description: Data Structures, Algorithms, Computer System Architecture, Operating Systems, Systems Design,  Information Retrieval, Computer Networks, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning

work.title: Research Associate
work.description: Deploy a prototype environment specifically for keyphrase recognition, topic modeling, language identification, and translation. Classification of large datasets of texts into subjects based on specific keywords and phrases of interest

work.title: University of California Irvine
work.description: Enhancing active learning through collaborative, and interactive small group instruction with students. Supporting professors and teaching assistants in lectures, labs, and discussions for 400 students.

work.title: Progressive Kids
work.description: Organized and guided the instruction of programming fundamentals for over 120 students. Collaborated with other instructors to improve instructional material to provide a better learning experience. All students implemented a graphical user interface for Tic-tac-toe in Python.

projects.title: Checkers AI bot
projects.category: a bot using Monte Carlo Tree Search running multiple iterations to predict next move

projects.title: Columns(Tetris)
projects.category: A game similar to the traditional popular game of Tetris.

projects.title: UCI Machine Learning Hacks
projects.category: A ml model used to classify the condition of the patient to check how urgent treatment is needed.
